definitions: To place sandbags around something for protection or to build a barrier.
To hit or stun someone with a sandbag or similar weapon.
To conceal one's true strength or intentions, especially in a game or competition, to gain an advantage later.
To treat someone unfairly or harshly, often by ambushing them with unexpected demands or accusations.
examples: They decided to sandbag the riverbank before the flood.
The attacker tried to sandbag the guard.
He was accused of trying to sandbag his opponents in the poker game.
Don't try to sandbag me with extra work at the last minute.
